segments.text: I notice the woman drying the plate, and it’s like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so quiet, and it’s almost eerie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the boy is going to fall off that stool any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the water is overflowing is so strange, like it’s not even real.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl looks so hopeful, and it’s kind of sweet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a scene from a movie, not real life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole thing feels so surreal, like time has stopped.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything seems, even though it’s all about to fall apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and it’s like no one even cares.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the children are going to get away with it, and that’s kind of amazing.
segments.speaker: PAR
